subject: Science
title: How Volcanoes Form
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on How Volcanoes Form.

hook.text: Magma sits beneath Earth's surface under enormous pressure. It wants out.

buildup.text: When cracks open in the crust, magma rises through channels called conduits.

discovery.text: At the surface, magma becomes lava â€” building a mountain with each eruption.

twist.text: Not all volcanoes look the same. Shape depends on lava thickness and gas content.

climax.text: Shield volcanoes are wide and flat. Stratovolcanoes are steep and explosive.

punchline.text: A volcano is just a pressure valve for a planet that's still cooling.
